listing.description: If you do not want to worry about doing anything when you move in, this refurbished home has to be the one for you. You will be able to enjoy the ultra-convenience of the fact that amenities, shops, restaurants, trams, buses and schools are just down the road.You will be pleasantly surprised how quickly you can get home with the various transport links within such easy reach. This stunning home can only be described as stylish and fresh; it is perfect for entertaining as the open plan kitchen/diner is a fantastic to invite friends and family over.Furthermore, there is also a separate lounge where you can put your feet up and unwind after a long day at work. If you find yourself with a house full, there is plenty of room upstairs for people to stay the night and ample room for a growing family. The bathroom provides the perfect environment for that long awaited well-earned soak in the tub. In warmer weather, the rear garden is a great place for the little ones to play in or for you to fire up the barbecue and cook up a storm.Finally, let's consider the location. There are excellent bus routes to East Croydon station, which has fast and frequent trains to London. This will ensure that getting to work or the latest West End show is easier than ever before. If you are looking to just pack your packs and move into a home, then look no further!What the Owner says:It has been a great experience to be able to design, plan and refurbish this home. listing.description: This stunning five bedroom terraced house is situated a short walk away from Woodford Central Line station so your commute into the City would be swift and stress free. This home has recently been extended and refurbished to provide a versatile and beautiful home for an established family. To the ground floor the cosy front room compliments the large kitchen/diner which stretches across the back of the property so for either a quiet night in or a family occasion it's easily accommodated.There is a ground floor bathroom which is handy if the children have been playing in the garden and it also alleviates the early morning rush out the door for work or school. To the first floor there are three bedrooms, (two of them are doubles), and a shower room. To the second floor the loft has been converted to provide two further bedrooms and a wet room. It was noticeable just how peaceful and quiet the house is. It also sits on a elevated position to the road with houses opposite so the views stretch far and wide across the local area and with the Juliet balcony to one of them, waking up and taking in the fresh morning air will never fail to put a smile on your face. There is a very large garden to the rear affording all the space you could need whether it's for the children to play, grow your own vegetables, have garden parties or just to relax and unwind in the warmer months.Agents note: The vendors have been granted permission for a single storey extension (6 x 6 meters). Further details can be obtained if required.What the Owner says:We moved from Snaresbrook to this location as we wanted access to the City alongside fantastic local amenities. Raylodge Primary school currently has an outstanding rating on Ofsted. Raylodge Park is a wonderful place to spend with family at the weekend. Very recently we converted the loft which provides a huge amount of versatility to our home. Apart from that we have laid new carpets, plastered, painted and decorated and all of this was done with a view of staying here long term so no expense was spared. This is a friendly street and we have lovely neighbours and can't express enough just how quiet it is here. It really is the best of both worlds as within a short walk you can reach an abundance of amenities and still return to a peaceful environment.Room sizes:Ground floorEntrance PorchEntrance HallLounge 12'8 x 12'5 (3.86m x 3.79m)Kitchen/Diner 18'9 x 10'5 (5.72m x 3.18m)StorageBathroomFirst floorLandingBedroom 1 12'6 x 11'0 (3.81m x 3.36m)Bedroom 2 10'7 x 8'0 (3.23m x 2.44m)Bedroom 5 7'7 x 6'4 (2.31m x 1.93m)Shower RoomSeperate WCSecond floorLandingBedroom 3 12'7 x 10'3 (3.84m x 3.13m)Juliet BalconyBedroom 4 15'0 x 7'3 (4.58m x 2.21m)Wet RoomOutsideFront GardenLarge Rear GardenOutside Storage ShedThe information provided about this property does not constitute or form part of an offer or contract, nor may be it be regarded as representations. The property currently provides 724 sq ft of accommodation in good condition with refurbished wood flooring throughout the ground floor. Some of the neighbours have extended the kitchen and converted the loft into another bedroom with en-suite so there's definitely scope to expand the accommodation if required.Situated within 5 minutes walking distance to Piccadilly Line Underground Station at Wood Green, 8 minutes walking distance to Alexandra Palace Station and 10 minutes to the entrance of Alexandra Park. Trains to Kings Cross and Moorgate run every 10 minutes from Alexandra Palace Station and this station is earmarked to become a stop on the forthcoming Crossrail 2 route. Wood Green Underground Station is in Zone 3 on the Piccadilly Line.Alexandra Park provides almost 200 acres of parkland with panoramic views of London from Alexandra Palace. The Park hosts a variety of events throughout the year; food, craft and beer festivals, a summer festival, a fireworks festival in November and a weekly park-run on Saturday mornings. There's even a farmers market every Sunday, perfect for grocery shopping; they have fresh and organic products and great coffee to sip while you browse the different stalls.The Step on Myddleton Road is a fantastic place to connect with people from the neighbourhood. listing.letting_fees:
Preliminary Payment (Holding Deposit)
Once you have found a property and your offer has been accepted by the landlord, we will require a Preliminary Payment (Holding Deposit)
Between £500.00-£1,000.00 (depending on the value of the property), deducted from your final completion monies.
Standard Fees
Administration fees
We handle all the paperwork and provide a tenancy agreement for you and your landlord to sign. The fee is based on the size of the property, the number of tenants and rental value:
• Up to £1,500.00 pcm:£600.00 per tenancy
• Up to £2,00.000 pcm: £660.00 per tenancy
• Over £2,000.00 pcm: £poa per tenancy
References
Includes an employer’s reference to confirm your income to rent ratio for affordability, a credit history check, confirmation of residency and a previous landlord’s reference (if applicable).
• £60.00 per person

Initial Move in Monies
All the initial move in monies and will need to be paid in cleared funds to us 3 days prior to move in.
Security Deposit
The deposit will be protected as part of the tenancy deposit regulations; we use the industry renowned my|deposits. 6 weeks rent prior to moving into the property, this will be refunded to you at the end of the tenancy minus any deductions, if applicable.
Inventory Check In procedure
A convenient time will be arranged for you to meet with the inventory clerk to formally check you into the property. Prices vary according to the size of the property.
• Studio: £125.00
• 1 Bedroom: £145.00
• 2 Bedrooms: £155.00
• 3 Bedrooms: £175.00
• 4 Bedrooms: £190.00
• 5 Bedrooms: £210.00

Other fees that may apply
Express Administration
Within 5 working days or less
• £120.00
Abortive appointment
In the event that an appointment has been booked with you and you fail to be present at the agreed times without prior notification to us.
• £85.00
Renewing a tenancy
• £120.00 administration fee per tenancy
Credit check at renewal
In some circumstances, it may be a pre agreed requirement for a new credit check to be obtained at the point of renewal.
• £60.00 per person
Landlord references
If you decide to move on and require for us to provide you with a reference to your new agent or landlord.
• £30.00
Tenancy Swap Fees
Administration: Covering contract negotiation, amending terms, updating the tenancy agreement during the tenancy and immigration and visa confirmation.
• £300.00 per tenancy
Referencing: Referencing the new occupant, including identity, financial credit checks, obtaining references from current or previous employers / landlords and any other relevant information to assess affordability
• £60 per tenancy
Note: All prices quoted are inclusive of VAT at 20%.

If you have any questions regarding our fees please feel free to ask a member of staff.

listing.description: A smart, spacious and newly refurbished three bedroom family home on a quiet road in Upper Leytonstone. You have a sleek and contemporary open plan ground floor, two gardens and a private garage, all within easy reach of the wild open green spaces of Epping Forest and tranquil waters of Hollow Pond.Francis Road is fast becoming one of East London's most sought after nightspots, with highlights like the Northcote Arms, Marmelo Kitchen, Albert & Francis and the Heathcote & Star all just a fifteen minute walk and all well worth a visit.If you lived here...You'll be relaxing in bright and airy, expertly appointed living spaces. The kitchen is pristine in white and grey with smart countertops and gleaming, box-fresh appliances. Sleek pale grey timber flooring run the entire length of the dual aspect space through to a capacious 260 square foot lounge/diner filled with natural light courtesy of sliding patio doors. Your rear garden is accessed from here (and via gates to the rear) – it's a lengthy eighty square foot mix of patio (ideal for barbecues and al fresco dining) and lawn with high fences and foliage for privacy.Back inside and there's a handy WC, while up to the first floor your bright grey and white hallway gives way to three similarly-styled bedrooms - a single ideal for a study or child's bedroom, a solid double with garden views, and a generous 150 square foot master bedroom. The bathroom is a gleaming white solace with a rainfall shower and secondary handset, tub and heated towel rail. Finally, your large, immaculate front garden and exposed brick porch makes for a great first impression. All quite a find indeed.Leytonstone tube station is half a mile on foot, and will get you directly to Liverpool Street in fourteen minutes, or Tottenham Court Road in twenty three, via the Central line. Leyton Midland overground is a seven minute stroll away for trains on the Gospel Oak to Barking line for the delights of Hampstead Heath and a myriad of other comprehensive transport connections. Drivers, meanwhile, can depart from their private garage and be on the North Circular in a mere eight minutes.What else?- Local schools are chiefly excellent, with seventeen primaries/secondaries within a one mile radius, all rated 'Good' or better by Ofsted and including the 'Outstanding' Barclay Primary School, less than a half mile on foot.- The property comes chain free, which means we can get you in with the minimum of hassle.- For your new local may we recommend the North Star? Something of a hidden gem, it's an authentic and friendly pub buzzing with locals and serving up delicious Thai food, all just an eighteen minute stroll away.Lounge/Diner (6.2m x 4.3m (20'4" x 14'1"))Kitchen (3.9m x 2.2m (12'9" x 7'2"))WcBedroom (4.3m x 3.5m (14'1" x 11'5"))Bathroom (2.1m x 2.1m (6'10" x 6'10"))Bedroom (4.4m x 2.1m (14'5" x 6'10"))Bedroom (2.6m x 1.9m (8'6" x 6'2"))Garden (24.38m (80))A word from the owner...."A perfect place to bring up a family. Containing all the essentials for a good life, the property combines spacious rooms with lovely gardens front and back.There's even a squirrel who comes to visit from the French windows at the back of the house! Great for relaxing and escaping from the city. Yet best of both worlds as it is close to Leytonstone tube and Hollow Ponds, in the sought-after area of Upper Leytonstone. Totally refurbished with no onward chain, ready to move into, with contemporary decoration throughout that you can add your own individual mark  opportunity not to be missed!"

listing.description: Walking up the driveway of this property gives you a sense of freshness in the air. Brand new bricks at the front, followed by new sash windows, you can tell this house is going to be a hit inside. Walking through the front door you come to the open plan reception room, which is flooded with light via the sash window, and from there into the kitchen diner, which boasts brand new appliances throughout. The bi-fold doors open onto the courtyard garden, making the latter feel like a natural extension of the kitchen, and perfect when entertaining over the summer. Back inside, ascend the stairs to the first floor, where you will discover three bedrooms (one with an en suite), and the family bathroom. Box fresh and ready to go – what more could you ask for...?Living Here...With the many pubs and eateries on Francis Road and the High Road on your doorstep, there’s always the perfect excuse (if an excuse is needed!) to indulge in some great food and wind down with a glass of wine or cold bottle of beer. For the shopaholics amongst you, Westfield is just a short bus or tube journey away, where you can hit a shop or two (or twenty!), catch a film at the cinema or enjoy a meal at one of many excellent restaurants. If you want to go slightly further afield, then the excellent local transport links mean you are just a hop and a skip (and maybe a jump as well) from central London, which means it is also very convenient for the daily commute. So whether it’s relaxing or working, local or central, travelling to meet friends or to work, this house is ideally located whatever you have planned…Dimensions:EntranceVia front door leading directly into:Reception Room (6.10m x 4.57m (20'0 x 15'0))Staircase leading to first floor. listing.letting_fees:
New Assured Shorthold Tenancies (ast’s) signed on or after 1st June 2019

The following charges are payable or potentially payable by a tenant:
Holding deposit - A maximum of one week’s rent
Security deposit - Five weeks’ rent, rising to six week’s rent when the annual rent is in excess of £50,000
Rent and Utility bills - Payable as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Unpaid rent - Interest at 3% above the Bank of England base rate, as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Lost Keys - Tenants are liable for the cost of replacing any lost keys or security device, including a change of lock or replacement of device if required
Amendments of Tenancy Agreement at Tenant’s Request - £50 per change
Early Surrender of the ast at Tenant’s Request - Should a tenant need to surrender the tenancy early and the Landlord agrees to re-let the property, the liability for the payment of rent will end once a new tenant is found and takes up occupation. However, the tenant will still need to cover the Landlord’s costs in surrendering the tenancy and re-letting the property

Non ast’s signed on or after 1st June 2019

listing.description: Purchasing this property with A lifetime leaseThis property is offered at a reduced price for people aged over 60 through Homewise´s Home for Life Plan. Through the Home for Life Plan, anyone aged over sixty can purchase a lifetime lease on this property which discounts the price from its full market value. The size of the discount you are entitled to depends on your age, personal circumstances and property criteria and could be anywhere between 8.5% and 59% from the property´s full market value. The above price is for guidance only. It is based on our average discount and would be the estimated price payable by a 69-year-old single male. As such, the price you would pay could be higher or lower than this figure.For more information or a personalised quote, just give us a call. Alternatively, if you are under 60 or would like to purchase this property without a Home for Life Plan at its full market price of £820,000, please contact Douglas Allen.Property descriptionThis charming house is situated on Hale End road which means the walk to Highams Park overground station can be swift and stress free. In the local area there is an abundance of restaurants and bars alongside retails outlets for your day to day convenience. There are three supermarkets within one mile, Tesco, Sainsburys and a Morison. Epping Forest and Highams Park are also within walking distance so bike rides, jogging and seasonal walks can be taken amidst all the different colours that mother nature has to offer. Schools in this area are highly regarded to and the road links offer excellent access to local towns, Westfield in Stratford and also Stansted Airport for international travel. This home presents a family with lots of versatility. The large kitchen/diner to the rear certainly seems as the heart of the home where many a family meal can be cooked and enjoyed, whilst the lounge which stretches from front to back provides all the space you could need for family gatherings or special occasions. The extra room to the ground floor is adjacent to the shower room, so this would really suit an elderly relative or would make a perfect office if you work from home. There are three bedrooms and a family bathroom to the first floor. Throughout this home it feels modern, spacious and bright. Beyond that as soon as you walk through the door there is a fantastic feeling of home. With off road parking to the front means it's easy to get in with your weekly shopping, and there is a pretty and private rear garden with a covered patio providing a perfect space for summer parties and barbecues.What the Owner says:For the past seven years we have really enjoyed this location. There is so much to do in the local area and some beautiful places to explore. There is a dental surgery close by and the doctors surgery is just 0.3 miles away.Since we have been here we have added a new roof, redecorated throughout, replaced the boiler and radiators and also refurbished the bathroom and shower room. The ground floor bedroom and shower room are perfect when we have people to visit and stay, but this also gives options for other uses. We have now decided to move to a different location but this has been a friendly neighbourhood and a happy seven years for us.Room sizes:Ground floorEntrance HallLounge 18'7 x 12'4 (5.67m x 3.76m)Kitchen/Diner 21'8 x 17'9 (6.61m x 5.41m)Shower RoomBedroom 3 13'3 x 8'10 (4.04m x 2.69m)First floorLandingBedroom 1 12'4 x 12'1 (3.76m x 3.69m)Bedroom 2 11'10 x 8'8 (3.61m x 2.64m)Bedroom 4 9'10 x 9'5 (3.00m x 2.87m)BathroomOutsideOff Road Parking To frontRear GardenThe information provided about this property does not constitute or form part of an offer or contract, nor may be it be regarded as representations. listing.description: Brilliantly positioned in the heart of N22 is this outstanding three-bedroom 1930s period house boasting an expansive size of over  of living space. The home presents in functional condition and provides the potential to add value and refurbish to one's taste.The house is made up two large reception rooms, a galley kitchen leading out to a beautifully kept garden providing light all through the day.The upstairs, you find two light-filled and substantially sized bedrooms, a single room and the main bathroom suite of the home. Also on this level, is access to the buildings huge loft space. This style of house commonly accommodates a loft conversion (relevant to standard permissions) giving the new owner the opportunity to add a level to the building allowing the inclusion of a large bedroom and en-suite.The garden is substantial in size. Showing a gorgeous lawn with shrub borders to get those fingers green. It is partly paved, allowing space for the typical garden seating furniture. A great place to keep all those useful bits. Due to its size, the garden could comfortably accommodate a large rear extension. An optimal option to have for future growth in living space. Precedents for this type of expansion can be found up and down this street and the entire area. At the end of the garden, you find the rear access of the home. Neighbours have built a garage at the rear which would accommodate all types of collecting habits!Perth Road itself has ample amenities in its surrounding, and these include the public tennis courts which are free to use, a flower park which has received a green flag award, a status only given to the best in London. Just at the bottom of the road, you find Lordship Lane. Perfect for those 'usual bits' that need to be picked up. The Tesco Express and grocers selling fresh produce contribute significantly to that requirement. Not forgetting the beautiful green spaces in its locality, White Hart Lane park is situated just behind the Scotch Estate and from the street itself you can access the favourite walking park with lovely greenery to match. For recreation, New River Leisure Centre is a 7-minute walk from the house, providing a place for a work out in its newly built gym, a track to run and stretch those legs, football pitches to enjoy the nations favourite sports and lots more!The amenities do not stop there with this property, within 10 minutes you can reach Wood Green Underground (Piccadilly Line Zone 3) which is found connected to the central shopping district of the patch. As well as the Underground you have the array of different shops which include a Shopping Mall along with a range of diverse restaurant's offering a variety of cuisines. When it comes to shopping and dining the Wood Green High Road is bound to meet all requirements, whether you are looking for clothing, household goods or groceries, there is nothing missed here.The property is offered with 'no onward chain.' When renting a property there are various fees to take into account.

A month's rent will be payable in advance as well as a damages deposit equivalent to a month and a half rent.

Additional fees include an administration fee of £240 incl. VAT; referencing fee of £51 incl. VAT for each tenant and guarantor (if required); plus an inventory check in fee typically £85-£150 depending on the size and type of property.

Once you've found a property you like you need to make an offer, you will be asked for an initial deposit (usually a nominal amount) to take the property off the market.

listing.letting_fees:
New Assured Shorthold Tenancies (ast’s) signed on or after 1st June 2019

The following charges are payable or potentially payable by a tenant:
Holding deposit - A maximum of one week’s rent
Security deposit - Five weeks’ rent, rising to six week’s rent when the annual rent is in excess of £50,000
Rent and Utility bills - Payable as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Unpaid rent - Interest at 3% above the Bank of England base rate, as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Lost Keys - Tenants are liable for the cost of replacing any lost keys or security device, including a change of lock or replacement of device if required
Amendments of Tenancy Agreement at Tenant’s Request - £50 per change
Early Surrender of the ast at Tenant’s Request - Should a tenant need to surrender the tenancy early and the Landlord agrees to re-let the property, the liability for the payment of rent will end once a new tenant is found and takes up occupation. However, the tenant will still need to cover the Landlord’s costs in surrendering the tenancy and re-letting the property

Non ast’s signed on or after 1st June 2019

For any individual tenant not renting a property under an Assured Shorthold Tenancy the following charges are also payable:
Tenancy Administration charge - £180 per tenancy
Reference charge - £60 per tenant or guarantor
Check-in charge - £144 per tenancy
Renewal charge - £144 per renewal

If a tenant decides to rent a property through us in the name of a business or company the tenancy administration and reference charge will be £480 for a new tenancy and £240 for every renewal.

All prices are inclusive of VAT.

As a member of The Property Ombudsman (tpo) for sales and lettings we subscribe to tpo’s Codes of Practice. This Government approved independent redress scheme gives consumers additional protection beyond that required by law. Our clients have peace of mind that there is free and fair redress available in the unlikely event of an unresolved dispute involving our agency.

As regulated members of ARLA and RICS this means that any monies we hold is insured. ​​This gives our clients peace of mind and financial protection that their money will always be safe in our hands under the RICS Client Money Protection Scheme.

listing.description: A spacious and contemporary brick-fronted two bedroom Victorian mid-terrace in Leyton, masterfully refurbished with partially open plan twin receptions, a generous bathroom and charming rear garden. With our Francis Road neighborhood just six minutes away, you've all you need just around the corner.You're perfectly placed for transport too; Leyton Midland Road overground station is a mere three minute stroll away for the Gospel Oak to Barking overground line and its many connections.If you lived hereYou'll be welcoming family and friends into your impressive, dual aspect and semi open-plan reception, coming in at a total of 230 square feet. Your lounge area enjoys a classic bay window with green views and sleekly engineered timber flooring underfoot which continues through to the dining space. In here you have pristine white walls and a seating area overlooking the outside. Into the kitchen and you're greeted by gleaming white metro tiles, a Dublin sink, filament lighting and solid dark timber worktops as well as gorgeous views over the garden.Out here it's a covetable mix of smart ebony decking and lush lawn with foliage to the rear. Head back inside and up to the first floor and you'll find the master bedroom. A generous double of over 140 square feet, it's a stately space indeed with light teal walls, twin windows and a vintage ebony hearth, while next door bedroom number two is beautifully bright in white with a plush carpet and peaceful garden views. Lastly, your immaculate monochrome bathroom gleams with more metro tiles, filament lighting and recessed spot lighting.Outside and you have all the shops and amenities of Leyton High Road around the corner. Drivers can be on the A12 in six minutes, and on the North Circular in about ten. There's no shortage of open green space within easy reach either; Abbotts Park, Leyton Manor Park and Jack Cornwall Park are all just a few minutes walk away. Alternatively, the sprawling woodland and blue waters of Epping Forest and Hollow Ponsd are all just a mile on foot for weekend strolls, picnics or boat hire.What else?- You have twenty three primary/secondary schools within walking distance, all rated 'Good' or better by Ofsted and including the 'Outstanding' Riverley Primary School half a mile away.- Brooks Farm, a working city farm and petting zoo, is just a six minute stroll (next to Jack Cornwall Park) and a brilliant place for family time.- Fitness fan? Recently-opened Anytime Fitness gym is four minutes around the corner for twenty-four hour opening, personal training, free and even virtual classes.Lounge (3.6m x 3.0m (11'9" x 9'10"))Dining Room (3.4m x 3.4m (11'1" x 11'1"))Kitchen (2.8m x 2.3m (9'2" x 7'6"))Lean ToBedroom (4.0m x 3.3m (13'1" x 10'9"))Bedroom (3.3m x 2.4m (10'9" x 7'10"))Bathroom (2.8m x 2.3m (9'2" x 7'6"))Garden (6.10m (20))Explore our 'Locals Leyton' pages for everything this uniquely placed district has in store.Like much of East London, Leyton has great transport links with the city and central London. Liverpool Street is just 12 minutes away, and you can reach Tottenham Court Road in 20.With the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park just across the A12 you have all manner of shops and amenities within easy reach.Housing stock is mostly sturdy Edwardian terraces, developed over time to provide a wide range of houses and apartments. Placed in something of a sweet spot between location and affordability, there are still bargains to be had.
listing.short_description:
A spacious and contemporary brick-fronted two bedroom Victorian mid-terrace in Leyton, masterfully refurbished with partially open plan twin receptions, a generous bathroom and charming rear garden. With our Francis Road neighborhood just six minutes away, you've all you need just around the corner. You're perfectly placed for transport too; Leyton Midland Road overground station is a mere three minute stroll away for the Gospel Oak to Barking overground line and its many connections.

If you lived here You'll be welcoming family and friends into your impressive, dual aspect and semi open-plan reception, coming in at a total of 230 square feet. Your lounge area enjoys a classic bay window with green views and sleekly engineered timber flooring underfoot which continues through to the dining space. In here you have pristine white walls and a seating area overlooking the outside. Into the kitchen and you're greeted by gleaming white metro tiles, a Dublin sink, filament lighting and solid dark timber worktops as well as gorgeous views over the garden. Out here it's a covetable mix of smart ebony decking and lush lawn with foliage to the rear. Head back inside and up to the first floor and you'll find the master bedroom. A generous double of over 140 square feet, it's a stately space indeed with light teal walls, twin windows and a vintage ebony hearth, while next door bedroom number two is beautifully bright in white with a plush carpet and peaceful garden views. Lastly, your immaculate monochrome bathroom gleams with more metro tiles, filament lighting and recessed spot lighting. Outside and you have all the shops and amenities of Leyton High Road around the corner. Drivers can be on the A12 in six minutes, and on the North Circular in about ten. There's no shortage of open green space within easy reach either; Abbotts Park, Leyton Manor Park and Jack Cornwall Park are all just a few minutes walk away. Alternatively, the sprawling woodland and blue waters of Epping Forest and Hollow Ponsd are all just a mile on foot for weekend strolls, picnics or boat hire. What else? - You have twenty three primary/secondary schools within walking distance, all rated 'Good' or better by Ofsted and including the 'Outstanding' Riverley Primary School half a mile away. - Brooks Farm, a working city farm and petting zoo, is just a six minute stroll (next to Jack Cornwall Park) and a brilliant place for family time. - Fitness fan? Recently-opened Anytime Fitness gym is four minutes around the corner for twenty-four hour opening, personal training, free and even virtual classes.

Explore our 'Locals Leyton' pages for everything this uniquely placed district has in store. Like much of East London, Leyton has great transport links with the city and central London. Liverpool Street is just 12 minutes away, and you can reach Tottenham Court Road in 20. With the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park just across the A12 you have all manner of shops and amenities within easy reach. Housing stock is mostly sturdy Edwardian terraces, developed over time to provide a wide range of houses and apartments. Placed in something of a sweet spot between location and affordability, there are still bargains to be had.

listing.letting_fees:
Tenant fee guide


Holding Deposit* - Maximum of 1 weeks rent (per tenancy)
* This may be a non-refundable payment
This fee is non-refundable should you decide not to progress your application/sign your tenancy agreement within 15 Calendar days (unless otherwise mutually agreed) or if you have given false/misleading information on the application form or any applicant fails a Right to Rent check. It will be returned to you in the event the landlord is unable to proceed.
Deposit** - 5 weeks Rent
**This is to cover any damages, dilapidations & defaults on the part of the tenant during the tenancy.
During the Tenancy (payable to the Agent)
Payment of interest for the late payment of rent 3% above Bank of England base rate.
During the Tenancy if permitted and applicable
Utilities - gas, electricity, water and sewerage
Communications - telephone and broadband
Installation of cable/satellite
Subscription to cable/satellite supplier
Television licence
Council Tax
Lost Keys or other Security Devices
Tenants are liable for the actual cost of replacing any lost key(s) or other security device(s). If the loss results in locks needing to be changed, the actual costs of a locksmith, new lock and replacement keys for the tenant, landlord & any other persons requiring keys will be charged to the tenant, If extra costs are incurred there will be a charge of £15 per hour, if appropriate, for the time taken replacing any lost keys or security devices.
Variation of Contract (At Tenant's Request and if agreed by Landlord)
£50 (inc VAT) to cover agents costs in contacting landlord, taking landlord instructions & preparations of new contracts (if required) & system adjustments.
Change of Sharer (At Tenant's Request and if agreed by Landlord)
£50 (inc VAT) per replacement tenancy or any reasonable costs incurred if higher:
To cover the costs associated with taking landlords instructions, new tenant referencing and Right To Rent checks, deposit registration and preparation of new legal documents.
Variation of Contract (At Tenant's Request and if agreed by Landlord)
£50 (inc VAT) to cover agents costs in contacting landlord, taking landlord instructions & preparations of new contracts (if required) & system adjustments.
Early release from tenancy
If authorisation is given allowing you to vacate the premises before the expiration of any tenancy agreement, you may be liable for the following:
A - Rent up to the date on which the premises are re-let or the expiration of the tenancy agreement, whichever is the sooner
b - Council tax, water rates, gas and electricity charges along with any other bills which are your responsibility under the tenancy agreement up to the date the premises are re-let, or the expiration of the tenancy agreement, whichever is the sooner
c - There will be a charge, if appropriate, for the landlord's costs for re letting the property
d - These costs will be no more than the maximum amount of rent outstanding
Other permitted payments
Any other permitted payments not included above, for breaches of contract or under the relevant legislation including contractual damages.
Please note: Should you report a maintenance issue with the property and a contractor is called out and their investigations find that the fault has been caused by the tenant/s or an associate of the tenant/s, or alternatively no fault exists, any cost for this call out will be the responsibility of the tenant/s. Northwood reserve the right to deduct any unpaid monies from the deposit.
Tenant Protection
Northwood Harrow & Wealdstone Limited is a member of nals which is a client money protection scheme, and also a member of The Property Ombudsman, which is a redress scheme. You can find out more details on our website or by contacting us directly.
